subject: RE: [junit] Re: Test Dependencies
msgSnippet: ... This is a good point that I never thought of. I may be misusing JUnit in this case, as I m merely doing this as a proof of concept kind of test. In other
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin Klinemeier [mailto:zipwow@...]
>
> Actually, that's a good point I should've caught the first time.
> Java's serialization framework shouldn't be the thing under test here.
> One could argue that the framework is complex enough that you might
> misconfigure it, but I think that misconfiguration would be more
> apparent from the save/load interaction, rather than examining the file
> format.

This is a good point that I never thought of. I may be misusing JUnit in
this case, as I'm merely doing this as a "proof of concept" kind of test. In
other words, I'm proving to myself that when I save something, I'm able to
retrieve it some time afterwards. The serialized object itself is only going
to be saved once, but read from the disk many times...
